Daily report
Response.Value: Beguin installation of air compressor Install air receiver . Beguin installation of airline

Response.Label: Daily report
Response.Value: Purchased parts to extend and install airline Purchased pipe and bayonet quick coupling fittings Purchased anchors and screws . Went out to source Parafin Removed rail from Y Axis Removed Accumulator from top of Y Axis . Removal of cable chain

Response.Label: Parts supplied today
Response.Value: Pipe fixing clips Pipe , Gloves . Nylon Fixers . Airline fittings .

Response.Label: Daily report
Response.Value: Fix air leak in System . Palletise Accumulator . Check for air leaks and repair . Found Paraffin supplier . Purchased Hose clamps . Mark out position for column .

Response.Label: Daily report
Response.Value: Went to look for piping to use as shuttering for civil work . Purchased Trowel . Washed and cleaned screws and repackaged . Started to excavate core drilled holes to specified depth .

Response.Label: Daily report
Response.Value: Cont excavation of core drilled holes . Tried to find Auger to deepen holes . Placed column in position and level .

Response.Label: Customer requires quote for follow-up work

Daily report
Response.Value: Cutting trials carried out. Carry on with STW

Response.Label: Daily report
Response.Value: Noticed a vibration coming from spindle vacuum rotary union. Removed rotary union but could not identify where the vibration was coming from. After refitting the rotary union tge spindle would not run as set speed and vibration was worse. Further checks carried out and then tested. The next time the spindle was run it 'ran away'. Investigation fiund the resolver had failed.

Response.Label: Daily report
Response.Value: Resolver stripped out and tests carried out to identify how the missalignment occured. Only reason that could be found is the back plate locating ring does not have a tight enough tolerance. Furher checks carried out to identify a better way of aligning the back plate.

Response.Label: Daily report
Response.Value: Further checks and investigation to identify the correct resolver and supplier. Measurements also carried out on setting up the resolver and backplate. Decision made by AWE to use HATC 5's resolver. Shim required to assist with stripping the resolver, so job will proceed on Monday.

Response.Label: Final job report
Response.Value: Resolver to be taken off HATC 5 and fitted to HATC 4.

Job description
Response.Value: Commence investigation of ballscrew support failure and requirements to repair

Response.Label: Daily report
Response.Value: Ballscrew removed and some investigative work carried out prior to being returned to original service visit requirement.

Response.Label: Final job report
Response.Value:
Ballscrew support found to have malfunctioned shearing depression dog from underside of saddle
Ballscrew removed to improve access- damage to screw evident, likely caused during failure of support
Not possible to remove support unit in current machine position- machine requires complete strip down for repair
Job on hold awaiting customer decision on how they wish to proceed
